page.title: 08The Gatehouse at Ashey
page.content: { The Gatehouse}was built in the late 1500s.The residents of the house now are Mr and Mrs Beak,who have lived there for 23 years.In the house they only have oil and electric heating,but no gas.There are 14 rooms including a five room granny flat. A couple of years ago they repaired the roof,and modernised the bathroom and kitchen. Mr and Mrs Beak have 180 acres of land and have 494{animals:}100 cows,50 calves,250 pigs,40 hens,40 ducks,12 cats,1 pony and a dog. They have got one of the most modern milking parlours on the Island.They produce 1000 gallons of milk a day so they have been upset at the reduction in quotas forced on them by the E.E.C. They get up at 6.00 in the morning, and finish at 7.00 in the evening.
